docs.text: Ingress ¶ *.mycluster.k8s.example.net should be configured to resolve to the cluster’s ingress-nginx service. To route a public hostname to a service in the cluster: Create an Ingress Apply the annotation kubernetes.io/ingress.class: nginx to associate with the cluster’s main ingress service Apply the annotation cert-manager.io/cluster-issuer: letsencrypt-prod to enable automatic setup of an SSL certificate Assign an unused hostname under .mycluster.k8s.example.net (every public service should start with one of these) Optionally, CNAME a custom hostname to the .mycluster.k8s.example.net hostname and add it to the same ingress
